title: Baslow to Chatsworth Walk Route

images.title: Roger May / Baslow
images.caption: Baslow, river and cottages on a lovely day in the summer of 2003

images.title: Peter Barr / Bridge over brook, tributary of the River Derwent, near Chatsworth
images.caption: Footbridge over brook near Nether End, Baslow and Chatsworth Park, Derbyshire. The brook is a tributary of the River Derwent

images.title: Alan Heardman / Baslow - Brook near Chatsworth Park
images.caption: Baslow - Brook near Chatsworth Park

images.title: Alan Heardman / Baslow - Cottages on approach to Chatsworth Park
images.caption: Cottages on approach to Chatsworth Park

images.title: Roger Temple / Thatched cottages near Chatsworth Park
images.caption: Thatched cottages near Chatsworth Park The path from Baslow into Chatsworth Park passes these cottages. Apart from this area around Chatsworth, there are few thatched buildings in this part of the Peak District.

description: This walk takes you from the village of Baslow to the splendid Chatsworth Park in Derbyshire. You can follow the Derwent Valley Heritage Way from the village centre all the way to the famous park and house. It's about 1.5 to 2 mile walk along a fairly flat path so suitable for most abilities. Along the way there's nice views of the surrounding hills and the River Derwent which runs alongside the park. At Chatsworth you'll find 1000 acres of parkland to explore with more views of the River Derwent, woodland trails and fallow deer.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in Baslow you could try The Prince of Wales for some post walk refreshments. The friendly pub does very good food and includes a roaring fire for winter days. In warmer weather you can relax on the Terrace garden and enjoy fine views of the surrounding hills. You can find the pub on Church Lane at a postcode of DE45 1RY for your sat navs. The inn is also dog friendly if you have your pet with you.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area you could explore the nearby Longshaw Estate or enjoy a climb to Baslow Edge for magnificent views over the Peak District.

display_address: Juniper Cottage, Eaton Hill, Bubnell, Baslow and Bubnell CP, Baslow, Derbyshire Dales, Derbyshire, East Midlands, England, DE45 1SG, United Kingdom
